medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Psychotic symptoms increased over the course of 1 year, beginning with a gradual change in functioning approximately 1 year prior to hospital admission. The family disclosed her HIV status to her around that time, and her efavirenz dose was increased. Symptoms included social withdrawal, decreased concentration, delusions, and loss of daily skills. Family found writings with delusional, suicidal, and homicidal statements.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of well-controlled HIV infection; psychiatric history included outpatient psychotherapy starting in May 2005 without prior hospitalization or pharmacotherapy for psychiatric illness.
medical_history.family_history: Biological father with a history of significant illicit drug and alcohol use; both biological parents had a criminal history.
medical_history.social_history: Lived with her paternal aunt and uncle since age 6; had renewed contact with her biological father shortly before symptoms worsened.
